Title: For 16:10 monitors/displays, custom aspect ratio options, especially 16:8.1 (1.9753:1) needed!
body:
**SmartTube version:** 15.30
**Device:** X96 Air S905X3 Android TV Box (Android 9 Pie)
**Monitor:** Samsung SyncMaster 933NW+, 19" 1440x900, 16:10  (with a HDMI to VGA active converter)
**Sample Test Video:** Youtube video named "FULL HD PM5644 test pattern - 1920 x 1080 60p - 1 Hour with 1Khz sound."

**Problem:** On 16:10 monitor, standard 16:9 youtube videos seem distorted, as vertically stretched and not proportional.
**Probable solutions:** Adding custom aspect ratio option for editing, or at least a preset AR as **16:8.1 (1.9753:1)** would solve most probably.

I still use an ancient 19" 16:10 1440x900 VGA Samsung monitor with a Windows PC and a X96 Air S905X3 Android TV Box. When i watch standard 16:9 youtube videos on Firefox on windows PC, the image is proportional and very well scaled. Of course there are approximately ~13mm black bars on top and bottom of the display, which is totally normal and expected. The photo below shows this situation, as you may see the circles, squares are totally scaled:

![000 Windows PC Firefox Duzgun](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67484569/181565008-884b5912-61af-4abc-8829-8e6f2d73677f.jpg)

But when i use this same 16:10 monitor on Android TV Box, the YT videos are full screen with no black bars on top and bottom, so the image is NOT proportional and NOT well scaled.  This is also expected, because Android TV Box outputs only 16:9 resolutions such as 1920x1080 or 1280x720. There's no option to select a 16:10 output such as 1440x900 or 1280x800 etc. The vertically stretched image can be seen on the photo below (the distorted figures are obvious):

![010 X96 Air SmartTube Bozuk](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67484569/181572167-bf0530d8-f71a-49a2-9fc7-8b9872fda254.jpg)

Then, how will we solve this problem? I know that a lot of people -want to- use their 16:10 monitors with their android Tv Boxes, mostly with HDMI to VGA converters, like me. I searched the web for a probable usage of custom resolutions on android tv boxes, at least with the rooted ones, but to NO avail. So i think the only solution will be using different aspect ratios for the videos. This will not solve the distorted images on TV Box menus, applications, games etc., but we can achieve well scaled images on videos, films at least.

So i checked the Aspect Ratio presets on the SmartTube app, but the available AR options are not the required one for 16:9 videos on 16:10 displays. Yes, there's a "16:10" option, but this is for the internal video scaling, just like the others. Choosing it makes an opposite effect on the display and we have black bars on the left and right sides, not up and down, the image seems squeezed from the sides. Choosing a bigger value like "2.21:1" makes a higher change than the required, and makes the image more squeezed vertically, the black bars become more wider than needed.

**Then, we need a proper aspect ratio. I think it can be calculated as follows:**
16:10 AR is 10/9=1.1111... times bigger vertically than the 16:9 AR.
To make the opposite effect on the image, we need to divide 9 with that result:
9/1.1111...=8.1

**So we need a custom aspect ratio of "16:8.1" (which is also "1.9753:1")**

After calculating this result, i checked it with the 2 different android apps; MX Player and KODI.

**MX Player** doesn't have a "16:8.1" preset, but has a "Custom" option in "Aspect Ratio" setting. Editing "Custom Aspect Ratio" as "16:8.1" (or "1.9753:1") fixes the 16:9 video distortion on 16:10 monitor. I get the 13mm thick black bars both on top and bottom of the screen on this particular 19" 1440x900 monitor, just like the situation in windows PC:

![021 X96 Air MXPlayer AR-16-8 1 Duzgun](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67484569/181584390-b4b06bd4-dd34-4fd9-8a0d-7bd4ed68b635.jpg)

**KODI** doesn't have a "16:8.1" preset, either. And i couldn't find other AR parameters or a custom AR option. But KODI has a "**Pixel ratio**" option in "Video settings". Setting "Pixel ratio" to "1.11" fixes the 16:9 video distortion on 16:10 monitor, on Android Tv Box:  (I guess this "Pixel ratio" option may be a universal solution for appropriate image scaling on non-standard displays, I'm not sure though.)

![031 X96 Air Kodi PR-1 11 Duzgun](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67484569/181589146-c9e4d87a-af27-4e35-8da7-24d8466460c6.jpg)


So, long story short:
@yuliskov 
Please find a proper solution to this relatively significant inconvenience :

* Add a "**16:8.1**" ("1.9753:1") preset to the Aspect Ratio parameters, at least.
or
* Add a "**Custom Aspect Ratio**" to the AR options, where we can enter some specific parameters such as "16:8.1" ("1.9753:1").
or
* Add a "**Pixel ratio**" option in video settings, where we can enter some specific values such as "1.1111" . (Just like in KODI)
or
* **???**

**Thanks a lot for your efforts on this great application! And thanks to all contributors!**

Title: Bridge not easily accessible / installable
body:
I'm a longterm user of SmartYouTubeTV / SmartTubeTV

I really appreciated the feature you incorporated into an old release of SmartYouTubeTV, where it would prompt new installs to install the bridge-app that allowed your FireTV to recognize SmartYouTubeTV as being YouTube itself / send voice searches for YouTube there / launch with the YouTube icon / etc.

When I installed SmartTubeTV, the old bridge updated to redirect to SmartTubeTV which was great :)

However, on a friend's fire stick, I had an issue a while back where after installing / uninstalling / reinstalling SmartYouTubeTV, the bridge app disappeared ‚Äì¬†as did any notification to install it

Moreover, when more recently I uninstalled SmartYouTubeTV altogether, and installed SmartTubeTV from scratch, I was never given an option to install the bridge app ‚Äì and thus, the FireTV refused to recognize SmartTubeTV as YouTube

I was at a loss as to what to do, as the bridge apk has no public listing that I could find ‚Äì be it in the releases for SmartTubeTV, SmartYouTubeTV, or anywhere else on the internet

HOWEVER, after digging through the issues of SmartYouTubeTV, I finally found this issue: https://github.com/yuliskov/SmartYouTubeTV/issues/697

In it, you directly link to the bridge app ‚Äì¬†https://github.com/yuliskov/SmartYouTubeTV/releases/download/stable/Amazon_SYTV_Bridge.apk

So I was able to download that, install it onto the FireTV, and viola ‚Äì¬†it worked perfect!

So... basically, I recommend making a public listing for that Amazon_SYTV_Bridge.apk ‚Äì be it here on this github in the releases, or elsewhere ‚Äì¬†and / or giving a menu-option in-app to install said .apk within SmartTubeTV

Thank you for your consideration!

Title: Bug Report: Smart Tube Application - Black Screen and Buffering Issue

**Description:**

Hello everyone,

I wanted to bring your attention to a bug that I encountered while using the Smart Tube application. When I open the application for the first time, the videos do not start playing, instead, I am presented with a black screen. Despite having a stable internet connection, the videos continue buffering repeatedly without playing.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Open the Smart Tube application.

3. Observe that the video does not start playing and a black screen is displayed.
4. Notice that the video continuously buffers without playback.

**Expected Behavior:**

Upon opening the Smart Tube application, videos should start playing smoothly without any buffering issues, given a stable internet connection.

**Actual Behavior:**

Instead, the application displays a black screen and continuously buffers the video content, preventing playback.

**Additional Information:**

1. The issue persists even when I have a strong and stable internet connection, ruling out network-related problems.
2. I have tried closing and reopening the application, as well as restarting my device, but the issue persists consistently.
3. I have verified that other video streaming applications on my device do not exhibit similar issues, suggesting that the problem is specific to the Smart Tube application.

This bug significantly hampers the user experience, as it prevents seamless video playback upon opening the application. I hope that the development team can look into this matter and resolve it as soon as possible.

Please let me know if you require any additional information or if there is anything I can do to assist in resolving this issue.

Thank you.

Best regards,

Title: Restore more granular playback speed options
body:
I'm not quite sure when the change happened since there have been a few updates recently (as of 2/23/23) but as of version 17.20, the speed options have been reduced to only 0.25 increments.

I'm here to request that more speed options be put back because the 0.25 jumps are too big. Going from 1.0 to 1.25 is just too much on some videos. For videos that I want to watch "naturally" but reduce the time, more granular speeds between 1.0 and 1.5 are needed. Above 1.5, I think the 0.25 increment is ok.

And I found the previous available 0.95 option really useful for watching foreign language videos that I am learning or have some comprehension of, because it made it easier to decode the words without making it sound unnaturally slow. Below that 0.75, 0.5, 0.25 is ok.

Now for those who thought there were too many options, I also was once annoyed that there were so many options, because clicking and scrolling through the menu was a bit troublesome, especially in the previous UI where clicking the Clock icon would pop up the full menu of speeds and if you were at 3.0x and wanted to go back to 1.0x, you would have to scroll all the way back down. However, I'd made the suggestion (not claiming sole credit) to have single click turn on/off to toggle speed-adjusted playback, and click-hold pop up the speed adjustment menu. When that got implemented, that reduced a lot of cases of having to click through the whole menu because you could go back and forth between 1.0 and selected speed with one toggle click.

I later got the Rii K25 remote control for my Shield (because I was sick of changing batteries on the slim remote) and discovered a great feature: the PageUp/PageDown buttons worked on SmartTubeNext to adjust the playback speed up and down without going into any menu and it was great to be able to adjust speed at any time without having to go into the UI and interrupting playback. So this might be another option for people annoyed with the longer menu, find an alternative remote with PgUp/PgDown keys. Not sure what other remotes work for this but the K25 does.

So please put my vote in for restoring the previous longer list of speed options: 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 0.95, 1.0, 1.05, 1.1, 1.2, 1.3, 1.4, 1.5, 1.75, 2.0, 2.25, 2.5, 2.75, 3.0.

If it needs to be configurable in the Settings, maybe just have a full option list of speeds from 0.25 to 3.0 in 0.05 increments and the user can select the ones they want to appear in the menu.

**Current Issue:** If you choose Notification Type "Confirmation Dialog" the dialog covers half of the video and darkens the other half. It requires user action to dismiss if a user wants to watch this segment.
**Proposed Improvement:** Instead of the current dialog introduce a non-intrusive semi-transparent "Skip [segment type]" button in the lower right corner of the video (with some padding), that appears and highlights itself by default for quick ok-button action, similar to "skip an ad" button in original YouTube app. When pressing back button on the remote, this skip button fades away (current behavior for the dialog), pressing any other remote button except ok and back, the normal UI appears, with this button attached to the right side next to the tittle and details, above quality info, and fades away with the UI, but remains there for the length of the segment that can be skipped. This allows for the user to have this button accessible whenever user decides to skip the current segment.
